SEARCH
Module com.example.demo
Package com.example.demo

Class LevelParent

java.lang.Object
com.example.demo.LevelParent
Direct Known Subclasses:
LevelOne, LevelOneTwo, LevelTwo, LevelTwoTwo
public abstract class LevelParent extends Object
ultimate abstract class for all levels. contains all actors, ui elements, timeline progression, actor handling, user control, level view control. instantiates every level through controller.

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type
    Class
    Description
    static interface 
    LevelParent.Listener
    listener interface for passing level name data and current user health value to controller to construct next level.

  • Constructor Details

    • LevelParent

      public LevelParent(String backgroundImageName, double screenHeight, double screenWidth, int playerInitialHealth)
      initializes all values and creates new group, scene, userplane and list of all actors categorized appropriately. initializes the background, player health and level view (scene). instantiates a new level view (scene) every level.
      Parameters:
      backgroundImageName - image name to be used as scene background image.
      screenHeight - height of the scene/background image.
      screenWidth - width of the scene/background image.
      playerInitialHealth - initial health of the user.

  • Method Details

    • initializeFriendlyUnits

      protected abstract void initializeFriendlyUnits()
      abstract function to initialize friendly units (user). called by all levels.

    • checkIfGameOver

      protected abstract void checkIfGameOver()
      abstract function which checks whether the game state has changed to a loss (user health decreased to 0) or win (level pass requirements achieved).

    • spawnEnemyUnits

      protected abstract void spawnEnemyUnits()
      abstract function to spawn appropriate enemy units in their respective levels. called by all levels.

    • instantiateLevelView

      protected abstract LevelView instantiateLevelView()
      # abstract function to instantiate and return a level view appropriate to the level.
      Returns:
      an instantiated level view for each level.

    • setListener

      public void setListener(LevelParent.Listener listener)
      listener interface function to set a class which implements the interface as a listener.
      Parameters:
      listener - assigns as a listener to the implementing class.

    • initializeScene

      public javafx.scene.Scene initializeScene()
      initiallizes the background image, userplane image and heart display in the levelview of a level.
      Returns:
      a scene with level view initialized (background set, user spawned and hearts displayed).

    • startGame

      public void startGame()
      starts the game, displays the entire scene on top fo the stage and starts the timeline.

    • goToNextLevel

      public void goToNextLevel(String levelName)
      indicates to the listener class to go to a level, specified by the levelname data and passes user health value.
      Parameters:
      levelName - string of the name of the level to be called.

    • updateScene

      private void updateScene()
      all changes which take place during a timeline update. numerous actor handling takes place and level view is updates

    • initializeTimeline

      private void initializeTimeline()
      initializes the timeline to indefinitely update every 40 milliseconds delay.

    • initializeBackground

      private void initializeBackground()
      initializes background image in scene and handles user input reading. when certain keys are pressed, userplane functions are called and a boolean keeps track of whether the plane is moving in a direction or not. on key press, moving in their respective direction updates their boolean value. on key release, as long as its opposing direction boolean is not true, the plane will stop moving. otherwise, the user plane will continue to move in the direction of the last key press. additionally, also handles projectile firing boolean, determining whether a new projectile should be fired at any given frame.

    • fireProjectile

      private void fireProjectile(boolean fire)
      setter of boolean firing which determines whether user plane should be firing a projectile at a given frame.
      Parameters:
      fire - sets variable firing to this value.

    • generateUserFire

      private void generateUserFire()
      generates user projectile while boolean firing is true. fires a projectile upon firing becoming true and firerate at 0. fires in a burst of 2 projectiles with a 2 frame gap between them and a 10 frame gap between bursts. will always fire bursts and cannot fire a single bullet.

    • generateEnemyFire

      private void generateEnemyFire()
      generates enemy fire by calling fireprojectile() in each enemy of enemyunit list. affected by an individual enemy's firerate (chance to fire at any given frame).

    • spawnEnemyProjectile

      private void spawnEnemyProjectile(ActiveActorDestructible projectile)
      passes the projectile image to the scene and adds this projectile to enemyprojectiles list.
      Parameters:
      projectile - projectile from enemy to be added to scene.

    • updateActors

      private void updateActors()
      call to update all actors contained in all actor lists. calls updateactor() of every actor.

    • removeAllDestroyedActors

      private void removeAllDestroyedActors()
      removes all actors which are destroyed (upon collision or health reaching 0) from the scene.

    • removeDestroyedActors

      private void removeDestroyedActors(List<ActiveActorDestructible> actors)
      removes a given actor which has its state set to destroyed from the scene.
      Parameters:
      actors - list of actors for function to affect.

    • handlePlaneCollisions

      private void handlePlaneCollisions()
      handles collision between a user plane and enemy plane. does not affect kill count.

    • handleUserProjectileCollisions

      private void handleUserProjectileCollisions()
      handles collision between user projectile and enemy plane. affects kill count which determines level progression.

    • handleEnemyProjectileCollisions

      private void handleEnemyProjectileCollisions()
      handles collision between enemy projectile and user plane. does not affect kill count.

    • handleCollisions

      private void handleCollisions(List<ActiveActorDestructible> actors1, List<ActiveActorDestructible> actors2, boolean countToKill)
      handles pairs of actors and their collisions. both actors will take damage upon collision. if count to kill boolean is true, the kill count of the user is incremented if a collision results in the enemyplane being destroyed.
      Parameters:
      actors1 - first list of actors to compare collision between.
      actors2 - second list of actors to compare collision between.
      countToKill - determines if the collision will affect kill count.

    • updateLevelView

      protected void updateLevelView()
      updates the level view, specifically the heart display of the player being updates to reflect the current user health.

    • getLevelView

      protected LevelView getLevelView()
      returns level view. used for level two's boss shield mechanic.
      Returns:
      the level view of the current level.

    • enemyIsOutOfBounds

      private boolean enemyIsOutOfBounds(ActiveActorDestructible enemy)
      handles an enemy being out of bounds vertically. removes enemy if true.
      Parameters:
      enemy - any enemy actor at a given time.
      Returns:
      boolean determining whether the actor is out of bounds or not.

    • winGame

      protected void winGame()
      game win state, stops the timeline and sends data to the listener class to indicate to show the correct win screen.

    • loseGame

      protected void loseGame()
      game lose state, stops the timeline and sends data to the listener class to indicate to show the correct lose screen.

    • getUser

      protected UserPlane getUser()
      returns the user when called. used in various classes to check for kill count of the user and instantiate a new level view.
      Returns:
      the user plane actor.

    • getRoot

      protected javafx.scene.Group getRoot()
      returns the root of the level parent. used in various classes to add elements to the level view such as user heart display.
      Returns:
      group of the scene.

    • getCurrentNumberOfEnemies

      protected int getCurrentNumberOfEnemies()
      returns the current number of enemies in enemyunits list. used to determine whether a new enemy should spawn or not.
      Returns:
      size of list enemyunits.

    • addEnemyUnit

      protected void addEnemyUnit(ActiveActorDestructible enemy)
      adds a new enemy to enemyunits list and scene.
      Parameters:
      enemy - enemy to be added to the scene.

    • getEnemyMaximumYPosition

      protected double getEnemyMaximumYPosition()
      returns enemy maximum position value. used in calculations for bounds of the enemy to spawn.
      Returns:
      a maximum value for a y position for enemy to spawn.

    • getScreenWidth

      protected double getScreenWidth()
      returns width of the screen. used in various levels when spawning enemy planes to determine its initial x position.
      Returns:
      value of the width of the stage.

    • getScreenHeight

      protected double getScreenHeight()
      returns height of the screen. used in various levels when spawning enemy planes to determine its initial y position.
      Returns:
      value of the height if the stage.

    • userIsDestroyed

      protected boolean userIsDestroyed()
      returns user state. used when determining if a user loses the game.
      Returns:
      boolean value of user isdestroyed variable.

    • handleEnemyOutOfBounds

      private void handleEnemyOutOfBounds()
      handles enemies moving out of bounds vertically. if true, destroys that enemy.
